description: Borrowed from French espalier, from Italian spalliera, from spalla (“shoulder”).

entries.meaning: A latticework used to shape or train the branches of a tree or shrub into a two-dimensional ornamental or useful design, as along a wall or fence.
examples: The garment stalls carried the traditional blue vine-dressers' outfits, sunhats, and the great willow pitchforks grown in espalier at villages like Sauve.

entries.meaning: A plant that has been shaped in this manner.
A row of plants that have been shaped in this manner.

verbs.description: espalier (third-person singular simple present espaliers, present participle espaliering, simple past and past participle espaliered)

entries.meaning: To train a plant in this manner.
